data.name: Bob. Build me a house!
data.description:
# Bob. Build me a house!
Bob is a very useful builder of houses. He always builds then the same **width**. You can set the **height** dynamically with _F_. You can choose if you want a door with _D_ if you don't want a door just leave it out. Finally you can tell him how many windows you want with **W**. 

Bob.Build("DWWFFF")
Bob.Build("dwwfff")

```
 _______||__
/___________\
|     _     |       F2
| [] | | [] |       F1
|    | |    |       F0

 W1   D  W2
```

Bob.Build("FWF")
Bob.Build("fwf")

```
 _______||__
/___________\
| []        |       F1
|           |       F0

 W1   D  W2
```

# Windows
The windows always start on the second floor on the left side. A second window is placed on the right side. The third window is placed on the next floor on the left and so on.

Bob.Build("FWFWW")
Bob.Build("fwfww")

```
Bob: Reduce the amount of windows by 1 or increase the amount of floors by 1.
```

# Door
A door can only be built with a minimum of three floors.

Bob.Build("FFD")
```
Bob: You need a minimum of three floors. To build a door.
```
